definition: A principle where a quantum system can exist in multiple states at the same time until it is measured.
application: It allows quantum computers to process a vast number of possibilities simultaneously.

definition: A machine learning model where two neural networks contest with each other to create new data instances.
application: Used to create realistic deep-fake videos or upscale low-resolution images to 4K.

definition: A phenomenon where particles become interlinked, so the state of one instantly influences the other, regardless of distance.
application: This is the foundation for unhackable quantum encryption communication channels.

definition: A type of machine learning where an AI learns to make decisions by performing actions and receiving rewards or penalties.
application: This is how AI learns to play complex video games or how robots learn to walk.
